column1: Moorpark is a city in Ventura County in Southern California. Moorpark was founded in 1900 following approval of the application for the Moorpark Post Office. As of 2006
column2: Moorpark was one of the fastest-growing cities in Ventura County. The town grew from just over 4

column1: The origin of the name "Moorpark" is unknown
column2: but most sources agree that the town was named after the Moorpark apricot
column3: which used to grow in the area (hence the apricot flower on the town's seal and flag). The apricot
column5: was named for Admiral Lord Anson's estate Moor Park in Hertfordshire
column7: the apricot was introduced in 1688.Some of Moorpark's previous unofficial and official names include Epworth

column1: Chumash people were the first to inhabit what is now known as Moorpark. A Chumash village
column3: was located in today's Happy Camp Canyon Regional Park. They were hunters and gatherers who often traveled between villages to trade. The village of Quimisac once controlled the local trade of fused shale in the region. The area was later part of the large Rancho Simi land grant given in 1795 to the Pico brothers by Governor Diego de Borica of Alta California.

column2: the secretary of the Simi Land and Water Company
column3: received the land when the association was disbanded. A map showing the townsite was prepared in November 1900. It was a resubdivision of the large lot subdivision known as Fremont
column4: or Fremontville. An application for a post office was submitted on June 1
column6: and approved by August of that year. The application noted that the town had a railroad depot. The town grew after the 1904 completion of a 7
column8: 246 m) tunnel through the Santa Susana Mountains. Moorpark was then on the main route of the Southern Pacific Railroad's Coast Line between Los Angeles and San Francisco. The depot remained in operation until it was closed in 1958. It was eventually torn down around 1965.

column1: Moorpark was one of the first cities to run off commercial nuclear power in the entire world

column1: Downtown is on High Street at the historic center of the city. The pepper trees that line High Street were planted by Robert Poindexter who was responsible for the plotting and mapping of the town. This area also features the High Street Arts Center (a Performing Arts center operated by the City of Moorpark)
The Peach Hill and Mountain Meadows neighborhoods are south of the Arroyo Simi. Moorpark High School is in this area

column1: The Ventura County Sheriff's Office provides law enforcement services for the city.
Moorpark had the lowest crime rates in Ventura County according to public crime statistics in 2000
column2: and according to Ventura County Sheriff's Department statistics from 2006. The FBI has ranked Moorpark as one of California's safest cities. It was ranked California's 8th safest city in 2017. No homicides were recorded in 2017 nor 2018. The 2018 FBI Uniform Crime Report reported a near record-low crime level.

column1: The City provides a "Volunteers in Policing" (VIP) program that formally engages citizens in supporting the police department and the community that began in 1994. In 1994 the program began with an attempt to open a police storefront run by the Volunteers in policing. Now the volunteers do a wide variety of non-dangerous tasks in an effort to assist the local sheriff's department including: parking enforcement
Moorpark is served by Moorpark Unified School District. Numerous schools in Moorpark are scoring above the 75th percentile in California
The Moorpark High School mascot is the Musketeer.

The Academic Decathlon team of Moorpark High School has a tradition of success. They have won the national championship four times since 1999 and in 2008 set the record for the highest team score in the history of the competition. The 2009 National Championship team met with President Barack Obama in June 2009.
Moorpark High School's football team lost 51 consecutive games to Carpinteria High School
column2: a national record that ended in 1997 en route to the school's first football CIF championship. The two teams have not played since.

column1: Moorpark High School was named an Exemplary School of the Arts.
Based on test scores in math and language arts
Moorpark is the home of Moorpark College
column2: a public community college and part of the Ventura County Community College District. Moorpark College is also home to America's Teaching Zoo and the Charles Temple Observatory
column3: both used for classes and community events.

column3: the largest chicken ranch in The United Stares at the time located just north of Moorpark
column4: California. Many chicken coops were spread over acres of concrete
column5: with millions of chickens in them. Most of the roads to the ranch were lined by large palm trees. The main office building had a giant chicken statue on the top of it which was later lost in a fire. Local residents were somewhat irked by the farm
column6: when the smell of it wafted to Moorpark on windy days. The odors also commonly flowed to the nearby town of Fillmore. The Pacific Ocean can be seen from the property peaks
column7: although it is farther inland. The business suffered a setback in 1972
column8: when millions of chickens were slaughtered because of the threat of Newcastle disease. There were three well sites on the property and a manmade lake near the main entrance gate. The main well at the hatchery is considered to be one of the deepest and largest privately owned wells in the entire county. In 1989

column13: a wildfire destroyed the dilapidated remains of Egg City.

column1: The city government operates under a council-manager form of government. The Mayor is elected at-large for two-year terms
column2: and four City Councilmembers are elected to staggered four-year terms. The Mayor and City Councilmember positions are non-partisan. Through 2018
column3: the City Councilmembers were elected on an at-large basis. In April 2019
column4: the City Council voted to transition to a district-based election system for the four City Councilmembers
column5: beginning with the November 2020 municipal election.The city government operates municipal facilities throughout the community
column8: Arroyo Vista Recreation Center and Community Park
column11: and the Moorpark Police Services Center
column12: which contains offices for the Ventura County Sheriff's Office and the California Highway Patrol. The Ventura County Fire Department provides fire protection for Moorpark
column13: with two fire stations in the city.
